message.content:
To solve the task, we need to extract the specific line item that corresponds to the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period from the provided income statement.

Let's analyze the given income statement:

```
| --- | Account                       | Amount      | Date         |
| --- | ---                           | ---         | ---          |
|    1| Main Business Revenue          | 22876677.56 | 2024-02-05   |
|    2| Total Revenue                  | 22876677.56 | 2024-02-05   |
|    3| Cost of Goods Sold             | 16400000.00 | 2024-02-05   |
|    4| Total Cost                     | 16400000.00 | 2024-02-05   |
|    5| Gross Profit                   | 6476677.56  | 2024-02-05   |
|    6| Administrative Expenses         | 1192395.86  | 2024-02-05   |
|    7| Selling Expenses                | 1461486.34  | 2024-02-05   |
|    8| Depreciation                   | 120631.67   | 2024-02-05   |
|    9| Financial Expenses              | 632582.44   | 2024-02-05   |
|   10| Total Expenses                 | 3407096.31  | 2024-02-05   |
|   11| Interest Income                | 13240.11    | 2024-02-05   |
|   12| Profit Before Tax              | 3082821.36  | 2024-02-05   |
|   13| Tax Expense                    | 1143833.89  | 2024-02-05   |
|   14| Net Profit                     | 1938987.47  | 2024-02-05   |
```

From the above table, we can see that the relevant line item concerning the inventories sold is "Cost of Goods Sold". The amount associated with this line item is **16400000.00**.

Now, we'll format this extracted value in the required JSON format:

```json
{"solution": {'value': '16400000.00'} }
``` 

This gives us the complete solution for the task.
